description: Discarding items in a non-acceptable container, leaving trash on the ground.
Wearing a face covering in a government building that obstructs identification and refusing to remove it when asked during a lawful investigation.
Operating an event without prior approval, licensure, or permit from an authorized Government Entity.
Unlawfully fighting or challenging another in a public place, disturbing by loud noise, or using offensive words likely to provoke violence.
Intentionally standing or waiting idly without apparent purpose on government properties.
Being under the influence of Alcohol or a Controlled Dangerous Substance in a public place.

offense: Failure to Yield to Emergency Vehicle
description: Failing to pull to the side of the road or safely move out of the way and reduce speed when an emergency vehicle is active.

offense: Failure to Obey Traffic Control Device
description: Failure to obey any erected or maintained sign, including regulatory and warning signs, or pavement markings.
Driving a nonfunctional or unsafe vehicle, such as with smashed windows, illegal tint, or missing doors.
Driving in a way that is negligent, demonstrating a lack of proper regard or attention to safety, with no regard to basic traffic rules.
Speeding in excess of 1 mph to 30 mph over the posted limit.
Speeding in excess of 31 mph to 60 mph over the posted limit.
Speeding in excess of more than 61+ mph over the posted limit.
Operating a vehicle without a proper license, or with a suspended/revoked license, or without a valid physical government identification card.
Turning around at an intersection marked against U-turns, or changing direction in the middle of a roadway by crossing a yellow line.
Passing another vehicle by a shoulder, median, or solid lines, or interfering with safe operation of an approaching vehicle.
Failure to maintain control of a vehicle within an appropriate lane of travel.

Performing a turn at a stop sign or red light without a full stop, failing to yield, making a left-hand turn where prohibited, turning from an opposite lane, or turning against a 'turn only lane' indication.
Failing to bring all wheels to a complete stop before moving forward, or failing to yield to oncoming traffic at a 4-way stop.

Parking in a fire lane, emergency lane, red curb, blocking a fire hydrant, parking unsafely, impeding traffic, failing to park within marked lines, or parking in a 'No Parking' zone or handicap spot without authorization.
Failing to use headlights to see safely in low light or allow other vehicles to see you.

offense: Unlawful Operation of an Unroadworthy Vehicle
description: Operating a vehicle that does not have a visible license plate.
Crossing a roadway at any place except in a designated crosswalk while minding traffic control signal devices.
Any modification applied to a vehicle that would unlawfully alter performance and/or any body modifications that would render the vehicle unsafe or unroadworthy.
Using a horn when not reasonably necessary for safe operation, or using it in excess.
Illegally operating a motor vehicle on a public roadway that is not registered to the State of San Andreas.
Maintaining radio frequency Radio 919.1 at all times during flights.

offense: Failure to Register Flight with Authorities
description: Failure to report recreational flight via 311 prior to takeoff.

Helicopter landing in undesignated areas, or less than 75m from any roadway, residence, or built-up structure; fixed-wing aircraft landing only on designated runways; pontoon aircraft landing on waterways but 75m from bridges, vessels, or swimming areas.
Maintaining minimum altitudes of 1500 ft over city limits and 750 ft over county areas.
Piloting any aircraft which does not have a valid registration, excluding rental aircrafts with tail number prefix 'RENT' and 'PEG'.
Hunting outside of the defined boundaries of the hunting area.
Performing the act of hunting or fishing without being in possession of the appropriate license(s).
Hunting outside of the window of 05:00 and 19:30.
